title: [Bug]: Microsoft.NET.StringTools 17.11.4 does not exist
body:
### Issue Description

[`Microsoft.Build`](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Build#dependencies-body-tab) v17.11.4 depends on [`Microsoft.NET.StringTools`](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.NET.StringTools/#versions-body-tab) v17.11.4 or greater, but the latest version of `Microsoft.NET.StringTools` is v17.11.2.

```
Installed Microsoft.Build 17.11.4 from <...snip...> to <...snip...> with content hash UMC7DfeFEHY2GGHHaghybUuUlLaByFHEFudR2PehMgDBuRuLAUePp1iaa4eFtVzepRzMtIbeSCVJCzzX3NV2Gg==.
NU1102: Unable to find package Microsoft.NET.StringTools with version (>= 17.11.4)
  - Found 15 version(s) in NuGet [ Nearest version: 17.11.2 ]
```

### Steps to Reproduce

Use NuGet to install `Microsoft.Build` v17.11.4.

### Expected Behavior

It installs successfully.

### Actual Behavior

It fails to install because the required version of `Microsoft.NET.StringTools` does not exist.

### Analysis

_No response_

### Versions & Configurations

_No response_

nodes.body: @rbhanda I think we missed this package dependency when we asked for a push earlier today. Can you check and push this one as well?
@reduckted, I'm sorry for inconvenience. We asked for publishing the missing package. I really hope it will be done today (Pacific time).
https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.NET.StringTools/17.11.4 is now present, though indexing is not yet complete.
